verses.verse: ((1 So long as Saul was enemy to David, all that had any authority under him, to flatter their king (as is the course of the world) did also most cruelly persecute David: against whom he prayeth God to plead and to avenge his cause,8 that they may be taken in their nets and snares, which they laid for him, that his innocency may be declared,27 and that the innocent, which taketh part with him, may rejoice and praise the Name of the Lord, that thus delivereth his servant.28 And so he promiseth to speak forth the justice of the Lord, and to magnify his Name all the days of his life.) ) Plead thou my cause, O Lord, with them that strive with me: fight thou against them that fight against me.

(Albeit God can with his breath destroy all his enemies, yet the holy Ghost attributeth unto him these outward weapons to assure us of his present power.) Lay hand upon the shield and buckler, and stand up for my help.
Bring out also the spear, and stop the way against them that persecute me, say unto my (Assure me against these tentations, that thou art the author of my salvation.) soul, I am thy salvation.
Let them be confounded and put to shame, that seek after my soul: let them be turned back, and brought to confusion, that imagine mine hurt.
Let them be as chaff before the wind, and let the Angel of the Lord (Smite them with the spirit of giddiness that their enterprises may be foolish, and they received just reward.) scatter them.
Let their way be dark and slippery: and let the Angel of the Lord persecute them.

For (Showing that we may not call God to be a revenger, but only for his glory, and when our cause is just.) without cause they have hid the pit and their net for me: without cause have they dug a pit for my soul.

Let destruction come upon (When he promiseth to himself peace.) him at unawares, and let his net, that he hath laid privily, take him: let him fall into (Which he prepared against the children of God.) the same destruction.
Then my soul shall be joyful in the Lord: it shall rejoice in his salvation.

All my (He attributeth his deliverance only to God, praising him therefore both in soul and body.) bones shall say, Lord, who is like unto thee, which deliverest the poor from him, that is too strong for him! yea, the poor and him that is in misery, from him that spoileth him!
(That would not suffer me to purge myself.) Cruel witnesses did rise up: they asked of me things that I knew not.
They rewarded me evil for good, to (To have taken from me all comfort and brought me into despair.) have spoiled my soul.

Yet I, when they were sick, I was clothed with a sack: I humbled my soul with fasting: and (I prayed for them with inward affection, as I would have done for myself: or, I declared mine affection with bowing down mine head.) my prayer was turned upon my bosom.
I behaved myself as to my friend, or as to my brother: I humbled myself, mourning as one that bewaileth his mother.

But in mine (When they saw me ready to slip, and as one that halted for infirmity.) adversity they rejoiced, and gathered themselves together: the abjects assembled themselves against me, and I knew not: they tare (With their railing words.) me, and ceased not,
With the false scoffers at (The word signifieth cakes: meaning that the proud courtiers at their dainty feasts scoff, rail, and conspire his death.) banquets, gnashing their teeth against me.
Lord, how long wilt thou behold this? deliver my soul from their tumult, even my desolate soul from the lions.
So will I give thee thanks in a great Congregation: I will praise thee among much people.
Let not them that are mine enemies unjustly rejoice over me, neither let them (In token of contempt and mocking.) wink with the eye, that hate me without a cause.
For they speak not as friends: but they imagine deceitful words against the (Or, clefts of the earth: meaning, himself and others in their misery.) quiet of the land.
And they gaped on me with their mouths, saying, Aha, aha, (They rejoiced as though they had now seen David overthrown.) our eye hath seen.
Thou hast seen it, O Lord: keep not silence: be not far from me, O Lord.
Arise and wake to my judgment, even to my cause, my God, and my Lord.

Judge me, O Lord my God, according to thy (It is the justice of God to give to the oppressors affliction and torment, and to the oppressed aid and relief, 2 Thess. 1:6.) righteousness, and let them not rejoice over me.
Let them not say in their hearts, (Because we have that which we sought for, seeing he is destroyed.) O our soul rejoice: neither let them say, We have devoured him.

Let them be confounded, and put to shame (That is, at once, were they never so many or mighty.) together, that rejoice at mine hurt: let them be clothed (This prayer shall always be verified against them that persecute the faithful.) with confusion and shame, that lift up themselves against me.

But let them be joyful and glad, (That at least favor my right, though they be not able to help me.) that love my righteousness: yea, let them say always, Let the Lord be magnified, which loveth the (He exhorteth the Church to praise God for the deliverance of his servants, and for the destruction of his adversaries.) prosperity of his servant.
And my tongue shall utter thy righteousness, and thy praise every day.
